page.title: 18LAND USE IN RURAL CORNWALL
page.content: A number of different land uses make up the area around{Bofarnel}. The main railway line into the Southwest is the main {transport}feature whilst the { {River Fowey}flows through on its way to the South coast. Agriculturally the predominant land use is permanent pasture and grass for silage, however, the higher, gentler{slopes}are given over to wheat. Bordering both sides of the River Fowey is deciduous woodland and one is able to follow this river by walking along the beautiful { {Lanhydrock}National Trust trail. Land is also given over to coniferous woodland in the {Brownqueen {Plantatiion.}In the past there was { {employment}in the China-Clay sheds but these are long closed and used by smaller enterprises.
